p: The bacterial strains used in this study are listed in Table S2 in the supplemental material. S. aureus isolates were grown overnight (O/N) on tryptic soya agar (TSA) or in tryptic soya broth (TSB) at 37°C with shaking at 200 rpm unless otherwise stated. E. coli isolates were grown on Luria-Bertani (LB) agar or in LB broth as described above. Where appropriate, medium was supplemented with antibiotics—ampicillin at 100 μg/ml, erythromycin at 10 μg/ml, or chloramphenicol at 12 μg/ml.
